newsitem.title: USA: High Plains Wheat - Basis levels hold steady.
newsitem.headline: High Plains Wheat - Basis levels hold steady.

text.p: Basis levels for hard red winter wheat held steady Thursday and early Friday, grain merchandisers in the U.S. High Plains said.

Movement was said to have been mixed. Some dealers reported that farmers had taken advantage of a rally in KCBT wheat futures to sell stocks. But other dealers reported that business had been slow Thursday.

Meanwhile, a large winter storm appeared to be headed for the central and southern U.S. Plains early next week. Meteorologists said the storm would bring several inches of snow to the area, followed by a blast of bitterly cold air.
Futures traders said the snow would likely help insulate wheat from the cold temperatures, lessening the risk of winterkill damage to the crop.
Basis values in cents/bu against KCBT wheat, cash=dollars/bu.
(Note: Z=KCBT December wheat futures. H=KCBT March wheat
futures. unq- unquoted, na - not applicable)
